column5: Has anyone fished out of Stanleys Resort on Eagle Lake this year. We are planning on going to Eagle next year and heard about this resort.
it's a beautiful resort, beautiful cabins and the owners are super people,Eagle lake is spectacular for its scenery, and the fishing is ok too.

Stayed at Stanleys in August of 09. Great cabins, we stayed in the duplex. All of the cabins are nice. Their boats a very nice and well equipped. Dock boys are very helpful to all of your needs on the water, all you have to do is ask. The portage lakes that Rob can send you to are outstanding I would suggest going to several of them during the week.I would get a guide for a day right away. It is an added expense, but, Eagle is big and the guide will put you on fish right away so you do not spend the week randomly fishing spots and catching few fish. These guides are good. Take a GPS, it is so much easier to get around with one. Most important, have a GREAT trip! Mike

Sportsmens lodge is another lodge to look in to on eagle lake, just 2-3 miles closer to vermillion bay. I have been there three times and Jim and Cindy take great care of there guests! I just stayed there last week and the walleye fishing was pretty good and the muskie fishing was amazing.
You could also look at Eagle Lake Island Lodge.
My group of 7 stayed at Vermilion Bay Lodge and had an excellent stay. Gord and Suzanne took great care of us. Email me if you have any questions.
